issue.title: How do I unsubscribe from JIRA emails?
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-4443](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4443). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
I am getting a ton of updates from this project and I haven't been involved in a very long time. How do I disable emails? I've looked all over the Jira UI and can't find anything. Can you double check I'm not involved in a Jira group that always gets emails?

I'm getting an email for every new ticket created.

![image-2019-01-31-13-31-59-606.png](https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12957173/image-2019-01-31-13-31-59-606.png)

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4443?focusedCommentId=16757738) by Ben Standefer (aguynamedben):*
Feel free to also just remove me from the project if that's the easiest solution. I don't need to be part of it. Thanks.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4443?focusedCommentId=16763703) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
hi `[~aguynamedben]` – new issue notifications are sent to dev@arrow.apache.org

You have two options:

- (the best one) Create an email filter to auto-archive emails with "[jira]" in the title
- Unsubscribe from the mailing list: email dev-unsubcribe@arrow.apache.org
  
  The first option allows you to continue to participate in development discussions
